heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 20 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 8.3°C) and outside temperature (down 6.3°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 8.5°C), dew point temperature (up 6.8°C), and outside temperature (up 6.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 369.1m higher than yesterday, 432.9m higher than the past week, 15.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 841m to a maximum of 1909m, averaging 1829.7m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1396.8m and 1844.9m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and periods of sunshine are expected. Similar weather conditions should remain.
